answers.answer: It was opposite for me. At 15 weeks was told it was a girl but at 19 weeks told it is a boy. I see OB every 2 weeks with ultrasound (high high risk) and they still say it is a boy at 26 weeks now. I wouldn't hold your breath or start shopping for things just yet.

pward0657: I would probably wait.. I've got a few more weeks before I find out, but I fully intend on waiting to buy pink or blue until pretty far into my pregnancy.. just in case!simplylizzy23: why are you considered high risk? if you don't mind me asking.. ftm & just staying on my toes! lol

With my first, I was told girl at 13 weeks and then again girl at 20 weeks.... this pregnancy was told girl at 15 weeks, 18 weeks, 22 weeks, and 27 weeks. .. im high risk and have ultrasounds every 4 weeks- although I think they are changing to every 2 now since I was just diagnosed with gestational diabetes...
All baby's start out looking the same sex. You will not know for sure until 17 weeks.

Yes.  Told twice (@12 and 18 wks) was boy. Then at 21 & 24 told girl!!  Boy was from drs office u/s tech. 21 was an elective u/s for keepsake pics and she said girl to our shock. Had us come back a few weeks later for free to check again. Girl again! If you go to my profile I'm sure you'll see where I posted about it!! Lol
Thanks ladies.. ill let u know what happens at 20 week ultrasound :)

question: Hi everyone! So I had an ultrasound today at 13 weeks and the tech told me it looked like a boy and she would be shocked if it turned out to be a girl.. then doctor said boy as well. But I heard the genitals are swollen at 3 months so its hard to distinguish a boy and girl. Yet my ultrasound pic deff looked like a boy. So has anyone ever had that happen where they were told in an early ultrasound they were likely having a boy and later found out it was a girl?
title: ultrasound today at 13 weeks, anyone been told boy then later found out was girl?
